snippet: Women of Ashkenazi Jewish descent who tested positive for cancer-causing genetic mutations have high rates of breast and ovarian cancer even without a family history of the disease, researchers said.
abstract: Study published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences shows that women of Ashkenazi Jewish descent who have tested positive during random screenings for genetic mutations that cause cancer have high rates of breast and ovarian cancer regardless of family history of disease; finding calls into question practice of regular screenings for mutations only if they report family history.
lead_paragraph: Women of Ashkenazi Jewish descent who tested positive for cancer-causing genetic mutations have high rates of breast and ovarian cancer even without a family history of the disease, researchers said.

headline.main: Study of Jewish Women Shows Link to Cancer Without Family History
headline.print_headline: Study of Jewish Women Shows Link to Cancer Without Family History

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
